item.title: Gunfire Reported in Gambia’s Capital as President Is Abroad
item.description: News reports ascribed the shots fired to a mutiny or attempted coup, but there was no immediate comment from the authorities to explain the confusion.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: Suspect in 2008 Mumbai Attacks Is Held in Pakistan on New Charge
item.description: A senior commander with the militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba was detained just a day after a high court said he could post bail in the Mumbai case.
item.dc:creator: By SALMAN MASOOD

item.title: Two Albanian Seamen Killed in Ferry Fire Salvage
item.description: The men were killed during an operation to salvage a ferry that caught fire off Greece’s Adriatic Coast when a cable connecting their boat to the ferry snapped and hit them.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Taiwan Considers Medical Parole for Jailed Former President
item.description: Chen Shui-bian, who is serving a 20-year prison sentence, is said to have health problems that include mild brain atrophy, severe depression and Parkinsonism.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Chen Shui-bian, the former president of Taiwan, in 2012. He is now five years into a 20-year prison sentence.

item.title: Ebola Patient Is Moved to London, and 2 Others Are Tested in Britain
item.description: The patient in the confirmed case in Scotland had worked with a charity in Sierra Leone. Officials were testing two others, in Scotland and England, for the disease.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: Aleksei Navalny, Critic of Putin, Is Given Suspended Sentence in Fraud Case
item.description: The punishment suggested that the Russian authorities were moving to sideline Mr. Navalny but not turn him into a political martyr.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW ROTH
item.media:description: Aleksei A. Navalny was convicted of criminal fraud charges on Tuesday in Moscow.

item.title: Bodies and Debris Found in Search for AirAsia Plane, Rescue Teams Say
item.description: A senior Indonesian official confirmed Tuesday that the debris was from Flight 8501, which was carrying 162 people when it disappeared on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS FULLER

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Before the Chinese Year of the Sheep, a Bulge in Births
item.description: Parts of China have seen full maternity wards, as parents try to take advantage of the auspicious Year of the Horse and avoid giving birth in the less fortuitous Year of the Sheep.
item.dc:creator: By JESS MACY YU
item.media:description: A hospital in Beijing. Mothers-to-be are trying to avoid giving birth in the less fortunate Year of the Sheep.

item.title: Search for AirAsia Jet Widens and Receives Assistance From U.S. Warship
item.description: The destroyer Sampson was dispatched to help look for Flight 8501 as the search area was expanded to 60,000 square miles.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS FULLER

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Lost Dreams of Home Ownership in Hangzhou
item.description: Investors in a never-completed housing complex are trapped in a state of residential and economic limbo.
item.dc:creator: By JONAH M. KESSEL
item.media:credit: Jonah M. Kessel/The New York Times
item.media:description: Protest banners at the Xixi Moho complex.

item.title: World Briefing: Russia: Sanctions Imposed on 4 Officials
item.description: The United States imposed sanctions on Monday on four more Russians tied to allegations of human rights abuses.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Gleb Yakunin, Russian Priest and Dissident, Is Dead at 80
item.description: Father Yakunin challenged the Soviet government for its restrictions on religious liberty and accused the hierarchy of his own church of collaborating with the K.G.B.
item.dc:creator: By SOPHIA KISHKOVSKY
item.media:description: The Rev. Gleb Yakunin, right, at a meeting in Moscow in 1990.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Lost Dreams of Home Ownership in Hangzhou
item.description: Investors in a never-completed housing complex are trapped in a state of residential and economic limbo.
item.dc:creator: By JONAH M. KESSEL

item.title: Hurdle in Hunt for Missing Jet: Tracking System
item.description: As the search for AirAsia’s Flight 8501 continued, aviation experts said the difficulty in locating it underscored the limitations in how planes are tracked.
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTOPHER DREW
item.media:description: Indonesian Army personnel on a search and rescue operation for the missing AirAsia flight on Monday, over the Java Sea.

item.title: Greek Patience With Austerity Nears Its Limit
item.description: The vast majority of Greeks are still experiencing the hardships of reform, with little evidence that the measures are working.
item.dc:creator: By SUZANNE DALEY
item.media:credit: Angelos Tzortzinis for The New York Times
item.media:description: Goods being distributed at a social center in Nea Ionia, Greece. Last year, the national unemployment rate reached 27 percent, and the vast majority of out-of-work Greeks have not had a paycheck in more than two years.

item.title: Europe Braces for Economic Fallout as Greece Heads to Early Elections
item.description: The Greek Parliament on Monday failed to avert an early general election, reviving the toxic debate over austerity as the way to cure the continent’s economic woes.
item.dc:creator: By NIKI KITSANTONIS and JAMES KANTER
item.media:description: Prime Minister Antonis Samaras said he would ask President Karolos Papoulias to dissolve Parliament to make way for early elections.

item.title: Guards Retreat in London, but Just a Bit
item.description: At some residences for the queen’s family, the guards have moved behind gates, and farther from tourists, because of concerns about terrorism.
item.dc:creator: By KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:description: Guardsmen now stand behind the gates of Clarence House in London.

item.title: Responses to Ferry Fire Off Coast of Greece Are Criticized
item.description: The Italian Navy on Sunday rescued 427 people from a burning ship, and questions quickly arose about the response of the stricken ship’s crew.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
item.media:description: Passengers disembarked with rescuers Monday in Bari, Italy, after being evacuated from a burning ferry.

item.title: World Briefing: Ukraine: President Petro Poroshenko to Attend Peace Talks
item.description: Mr. Poroshenko said he would meet in Kazakhstan on Jan. 15 with the leaders of Russia, Germany and France to discuss a peace settlement for eastern Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Britain: Ebola Case Reported in Glasgow
item.description: A woman who had been working in Sierra Leone was being treated Monday for Ebola in a Glasgow hospital.
item.dc:creator: By KATRIN BENNHOLD
